SEARCH
Package gw.api.claim

Class NewClaimWizardInfoBase

java.lang.Object
gw.api.web.wizard.WizardInfo
gw.api.claim.NewClaimWizardInfoBase
public class NewClaimWizardInfoBase extends WizardInfo
This class is the UI-visible interface of the New Claim Wizard.

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type
    Field
    Description
    static final String
    SYMBOL_NAME
    Name used, by convention, whenever new claim wizard info is added to symbol set.

    Create a new NewClaimWizardInfoBase object, given the actual New Claim Wizard location and the IType of the check object for Auto First and Final.

  • Method Details

    • createClaim

      public Claim createClaim(LossType lossType, String quickClaimMode, Date lossDate, boolean pageMode)
      Create a new claim with the given loss type, quick claim mode, loss date, and Page Mode. The new claim is created in the wizard's bundle.
      Parameters:
      lossType - loss type, possibly null.
      quickClaimMode - quick claim mode, possibly null.
      lossDate - loss date, possibly null.
      pageMode - is the mode the FNOL wizard first page will be in : Search or Create
      Returns:
      the newly created claim, never null.

    • createClaim

      public Claim createClaim(LossType lossType, String quickClaimMode, Date lossDate)
      Create a new claim with the given loss type, quick claim mode and loss date. The new claim is created in the wizard's bundle.
      Parameters:
      lossType - loss type, possibly null.
      quickClaimMode - quick claim mode, possibly null.
      lossDate - loss date, possibly null.
      Returns:
      the newly created claim, never null.

    • isAtHighWaterMark

      public boolean isAtHighWaterMark()
      Is the wizard at its high water mark.
      Returns:
      true if the current step is also the high water mark, or if the wizard has not been started, false otherwise.

    • reset

      public void reset(LossType lossType, String quickClaimMode)
      Completely resets the wizard by canceling it and re-entering. The loss type and quick claim mode are set to the given values and everything except the claim's loss date is lost.

      The loss type determines many fundamental things about a claim - the type of policy it can have, available exposure types etc. So if the user leaves the first step, where the loss type is set, and later returns to change it then we discard everything entered so far (because it may well not apply to the new loss type). Then we restart the wizard with the new loss type. Similarly, changing the quick claim mode causes a complete reset.

      Parameters:
      lossType - the new loss type
      quickClaimMode - the new quick claim mode

    • resetSteps

      public void resetSteps()
      Resets the wizard steps.

      public IQuickClaimMode getQuickClaim()
      The current quick claim mode, or null if not a quick claim.

      Parameters:

    • getQuickClaimOptions

      public List<IQuickClaimMode> getQuickClaimOptions()
      The list of available quick claim options, given the current claim state. This is not always the full list of quick claim options given in the FNOLWizard.pcf file, only those for which the condition expression evaluates to true. Used to populate the UI control for selecting the quick claim mode.

    • getAvailablePolicyTypes

      public PolicyType[] getAvailablePolicyTypes()
      The policy types suitable for the claim's loss type.

      Parameters:

    • getPolicySummariesOrSelected

      public IQueryBeanResult<PolicySummary> getPolicySummariesOrSelected(IQueryBeanResult<PolicySummary> summaries, PolicySummary selected)
      If selected is non null, returns just the selected summary, wrapped in a query processor. Otherwise returns the given query processor containing all matching policy summaries
      Parameters:
      summaries - a query processor containing all matching policy summaries
      selected - the currently selected policy summary, or null
      Returns:
      if selected is not null, a query processor wrapping selected, otherwise summaries

    • getPolicyDescription

      public NewClaimPolicyDescription getPolicyDescription()
      An object describing the policy to be used for the new claim. The description is used to look up the policy via the policy plugin, or to create a new, unverified policy.

    • setPolicyDescription

      public void setPolicyDescription(NewClaimPolicyDescription description)
      Set an object describing the policy to be used for the new claim. The description is used to look up the policy via the policy plugin, or to create a new, unverified policy.
      Parameters:
      description -

    • setPolicyDescription

      public void setPolicyDescription(PolicySummary policySummary)
      Set an object describing the policy to be used for the new claim. The policySummary is used to look up the policydescription and then call setPolicyDescription with the description
      Parameters:
      policySummary -

    • setForcePolicyReset

      public void setForcePolicyReset(boolean forcePolicyReset)
      Setting this to true will force all subsequent calls to NewClaimPolicy.setPolicy() to reset the policy on the claim. Use with caution.
      Parameters:
      forcePolicyReset - True if it is desired to force a policy on the claim to reset during the FNOL wizard.

    • setPolicy

      public void setPolicy()
      Lookup or create a policy for the new claim, based on the current policy description. This method has to be careful if the policy is already set; if the policy description matches the existing policy then it will usually do nothing. The only exception is that if the user explicitly picked a new policy then the policy will be refreshed, even if the existing policy exactly matches the description. Reinitialize the VehicleMap stored in _newClaimWizard after setting Policy

    • updateCurrency

      public void updateCurrency()
      In multicurrency mode, notifies this object that the Claim currency may have changed and that any internal copies should be updated. Does nothing in single-currency mode.

    • initializeNewClaimCheck

      public void initializeNewClaimCheck()
      Create the check object for the Auto First and Final flow.

    • setPolicyWithCriteriaIfNeeded

      public void setPolicyWithCriteriaIfNeeded(PolicySearchCriteria criteriaIfNeeded)
      Lookup or create a policy for the new claim, based on the current policy description. This method has to be careful if the policy is already set; if the policy description matches the existing policy then it will usually do nothing. The only exception is that if the user explicitly picked a new policy then the policy will be refreshed, even if the existing policy exactly matches the description. If the policy description indicates that no policy was selected, it will look up a policy based on the given criteria if it is non-null, otherwise based on the policy number in the poilcy description and the loss date of the claim.

    • isUsingVerifiedPolicy

      public boolean isUsingVerifiedPolicy()
      Is the claim using an unverified policy. Used to decide whether to skip the policy description wizard steps.

    • loadPolicyFromAdapter

      public Policy loadPolicyFromAdapter(String policyNumber, Date lossDate)
      Loads a Policy object based on the specified number and loss date. If no such policy can be found or if multiple policies match the criteria, returns null. Otherwise, returns the appropriate Policy object.
      Parameters:
      policyNumber - the policy loss date
      lossDate - the claim loss date
      Returns:
      matching policy, or null if no match or multiple matches

    • isFinishingCommit

      public boolean isFinishingCommit()
      True if the user clicked Finish to end the New Claim Wizard. This value is only valid inside the beforeCommit expression of the wizard.
      Returns:
      true inside beforeCommit if Finishing the wizard

    • isClaimSaved

      public boolean isClaimSaved()
      Has the claim been saved yet. The claim is saved in draft form during the wizard so that it can be retrieved even if the server crashes before the user finishes the wizard.

    • addExposure

      public Exposure addExposure(Claim claim, Coverage coverage, CoverageType coverageType, CoverageSubtype coverageSubtype)
      Add a new exposure to the given claim, with the given coverage, coverage type and coverage subtype (the coverage may be null). The exposure is created complete with an appropriate Incident.@param claim
      Parameters:
      coverage -
      coverageType -
      coverageSubtype -
      Returns:
      the exposure added

      Add a new exposure to the given claim, with the given coverage, coverage type and coverage subtype (the coverage may be null). The exposure is created with a null Incident.
      Parameters:

      coverage -
      coverageType -
      coverageSubtype -

    • removeExposureFromAssignments

      public void removeExposureFromAssignments(Exposure exposure)
      Remove the given exposure from the list of assignments, if the list is set up. This method is used if the creation of a new exposure is canceled. The exposure itself will automatically get deleted as part of the bundle rollback, but its registration in the assignment list has to be removed separately.
      Parameters:
      exposure - the exposure to be removed.

    • showNewExposureMenu

      public boolean showNewExposureMenu()
      Should the new exposure menu be shown. It should only appear on the exposures step, and only if the claim loss type allows the user to manually create exposures.

    • createClaimContact

      public ClaimContact createClaimContact(IType type)
      Creates a new claim contact of the given type, associated with the new claim

    • addClaimContact

      public ClaimContact addClaimContact(Contact contact)
      Adds a new claim contact for the given contact. There are two possible cases:
      • There is already a matching claim contact (one with the same address book UID) on the claim. In this case the existing claim contact is returned and the given contact is evicted from the bundle
      • There is no matching claim contact. In this case the given contact is added as a new claim contact

    • isContactNew

      public boolean isContactNew(Contact contact)
      Used when the user picks a contact using the address book picker; checks whether the contact is already present on the claim or needs to be added as a new contact.

    • cancelClaimContact

      public void cancelClaimContact(ClaimContact claimContact)
      Called if the user cancels out of the new claim party page while it was editing a brand new claim contact. Removes the given claim contact and its associated contact from the bundle. Once the claim contact and associated beans are removed the current page is refreshed. Unfortunately this cannot be handled by the standard "refresh" action listener because that will try to refresh the canceled popup, while we need to refresh the newly exposed parties involved page.

    • checkForNewDuplicateClaims

      public boolean checkForNewDuplicateClaims()
      Runs the duplicate claim check query and compares the results to the last time this method was called.
      Returns:
      true if there are duplicate claims and this is the first call of the method or the duplicates are different from the set found last time. False otherwise.

    • getDuplicateClaims

      public Claim[] getDuplicateClaims()
      The list of duplicate claims found when checkForNewDuplicates was called. Can only be called after checkForNewDuplicates.
      Returns:
      the duplicate claims or an empty array if there are no duplicates.

      public void goAfterFinish()
      Go to the page the wizard should go to when it is finished. Normally this is the new claim saved page, but quick claims can be configured to go to the check wizard.
